snippet: Turkey’s problems extend past bond purchases and interest rates to questions about the stability of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s government.
abstract: Turkey's Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan criticizes bold move by country's central bank to raise interest rates to halt decline in nation's currency, saying move will lead to inflation; Erdogan's remarks, which fly in the face of accepted economic logic, have only added to jitters among investors who have battered the Turkish stock market.

byline.contributor: Ceylan Yeginsu and Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Turkey’s problems extend past bond purchases and interest rates to questions about the stability of Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s government.

headline.main: A Leader Shows Vulnerability in Turkey’s Cash Crisis
headline.print_headline: A Show of Vulnerability in Turkey’s Cash Crisis
